DIV1.P: THE ENCHANTER; OR, LOVE and MAGIC.
THE ENCHANTER; OR, LOVE and MAGIC. A MUSICAL DRAMA.
As it is performed at the Theatre-Royal in Drury-Lane. The MUSIC composed By Mr. SMITH.
LONDON: Printed for J. and R. TONSON, in the Strand. MDCCLX.

DIV1.HEAD: ADVERTISEMENT.
DIV1.P: AS the Recitative commonly appears the most tedious part of a Musical Enter∣tainment, the Writer of the following little Piece has avoided it as much as possible; and has en∣deavour'd to carry on what Fable there is, chiefly by the Songs.—The Reader is desired to take notice, that the passages distinguished by inverted commas, are omitted in the Representation.

LIST.ITEM: MOROC the Enchanter, by Mr. CHAMPNES.
KALIEL, Attendant Spirit, by Master LIONI.
ZOREB, contracted to ZAIDA, by Mr. LOWE.

BODY.HEAD: THE ENCHANTER; OR, LOVE and MAGIC.

DIV2.HEAD: ACT I. SCENE I.
DIV2.STAGE: A Room in the Enchanter's Castle.

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: O Love, Destroyer Love, this Ravage cease,
Or give me Conquest, or restore my Peace.

LG.HEAD: AIR.
LG.L: The Hinds that whistle Care away,
The Birds that sing, the Beasts that play,
Shew what a Wretch I am!
" A Wretch of Reason and of Power,

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: O Kaliel! Kaliel! Speak thou faithful Slave,
What Hope?—Will Zaida yield?—Alas, I rave!

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: Torn from her Lover's Arms,—The mournful Fair,
Rejects your Vows, and cherishes Despair;
Like a transplanted Flower, the blooming Spoil,
Droops in a foreign, tho' a richer Soil.

SP.SPEAKER: MOROC.
SP.L: Obdurate Fair-one! What uncommon Mould
Impress'd thy Mind—That Pleasure, Power, nor Gold
Can soften or allure it;—Take this Wand;— [Gives a Wand to Kaliel.
Again persuade,—implore,—at thy Command
Joys shall attend—While I with other Arms
My Rival seek, and Hell shall aid my Charms.

LG.L: Let your Spells her Fancy bind,
Thro' her Senses reach her Mind.

DIV2.HEAD: SCENE IV.
DIV2.STAGE: A Garden belonging to the Enchanter.

LG.HEAD: AIR.
LG.L: Intruder Sleep! In vain you try
To hush my Breast, and close my Eye;
The Morning Dews refresh the Flow'r,

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: O Let not Grief your Bloom destroy,
Youth's fairest Blossoms spring from Joy,
And Beauty's Cheek with Tints supply,
Which nipt by Sorrow fade and die.
No Clouds shall shade the Day,
What's Life without Love, what Love without Thee?

LG.HEAD: RECIT. Accomp.
LG.L: To Zaida's Ears thy Strains might sweetly flow,
Had Zoreb's Air or Face her Bosom fir'd;
No transient Passion caught her Heart,—Oh, no!
Can Passion die, that Virtue has inspir'd?

LG.HEAD: AIR.
LG.L: Whate'er you say, whate'er you do,
My Heart shall still be fix'd and true;
And rages there in Gusts and Storms;
But Love with us a constant Gale
Just swells the Sea, and fills the Sail;
Neither of Winds or Waves the Sport,
We rule the Helm, and gain the Port.

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: Ye Votaries of Mirth and Love,
In all your various Mazes move,
The happiest Union known on Earth,
Is Mirth with Love, and Love with Mirth.

DIV2.HEAD: SCENE VI.
DIV2.STAGE: LYSSA enters with her Followers, as the Votaries of Mirth and Love.

LG.L: And tho' the Tongue says, nay;

DIV2.STAGE: [A Dance by the Followers of Lyssa.

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: 'Tis thus we revel, dance and play,

SP.SPEAKER: LYSSA.
SP.L: Would you taste the Sweets of Love,
Ever change, and ever rove,
Fly at Pleasure, and away.
Love's the Cup of Bliss and Woe,
Nectar if you taste and go,
Poison if you stay.

SP.SPEAKER: ZAIDA.
SP.L: Would you taste the Sweets of Love,
Never change and never rove,
Fly from Pleasures that betray.
Love's the Cup of Bliss, and Woe,
Poison if you taste and go,
Nectar if you stay.

DIV2.HEAD: ACT II. SCENE I.
DIV2.STAGE: ZAIDA, LYSSA, and other female Spirits following.

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: Shame of thy Sex—begone—nor haunt me more.

SP.SPEAKER: LYSSA.

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: Will Zaida's Bosom from a Woman hide,
What to conceal from Man, is Art and Pride?
Behold! Power's sovereign Charm to soften Hate,
What melts us most!—Variety and State!

SP.STAGE: [Waves her Wand, and the whole Scene and Decorations change.

LG.HEAD: AIR.
LG.L: Turn and see what Pleasures woo you,
Let not Love in vain pursue you,
Seize his Blessings while you may,
Love has Wings and will not stay.

LG.HEAD: CHORUS.
LG.L: Seize his Blessings whilst you may,
Love has Wings, and will not stay.

LG.HEAD: RECIT. Accomp.
LG.L: My Zoreb's stronger Spells to break;
For him alone I draw my Breath,
With him I could rejoice in Death.

DIV2.STAGE: [It thunders, grows dark, and the Garden shakes, All the Women run off, but Zaida and Lyssa.

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: 'Tis Past—the softer Passions take their Flight,
Moroc, comes arm'd in Terrors and in Night!
Destruction in his Eye, and in his Hand,
The Scepter of His Wrath—His Ebon Wand.

LG.HEAD: RECIT. Accomp.
LG.L: No more I come with Sighs and Pray'is,
A proud ungrateful Fair to sue:
A Festival for Love and you!

SP.SPEAKER: LYSSA,
SP.L: O hear her Sighs, believe her Tears,
The Heart may change that pants with Fears. To Moroc.

SP.SPEAKER: ZAIDA.
SP.L: Hear not my Sighs, nor trust my Tears,
My Heart may pant, but not with Fears:
His Treasure lost, the Miser mourns.

SP.SPEAKER: LYSSA.
SP.L: More Treasure found, his Joy returns.

SP.SPEAKER: MOROC.
SP.L: Hence Jealousy and love-sick Cares!
Vengeance now my Bosom tears!

SP.SPEAKER: LYSSA.
SP.L: " The Joys of Power will here attend thee!

SP.SPEAKER: ZAIDA.
SP.L: " The Joys of Love with Zoreb send me!

SP.SPEAKER: LYSSA.
SP.L: " With him your Heart new Woes would prove.

SP.SPEAKER: ZAIDA.
SP.L: " I fear no Woes with him I love.

LG.L: " Away with Love and fond Desires—
" Vengeance rage with all thy Fires."

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: Lyssa, depart!—this is no Hour for Joy,
I come not now to pity; but destroy— [Exit Lyssa, &c.
To Zaida's Arms her Lover I resign;
He's dead, and dying thought you mine,
For him alone you draw your Breath,
With him you shall rejoice in Death!

DIV2.HEAD: SCENE III.
DIV2.STAGE: A Tomb rises from the Ground, in which ZOREB lies, KALIEL standing by him with his Wand on his Breast.

SP.SPEAKER: ZAIDA.

LG.HEAD: RECIT. Accomp.
LG.L: My Zoreb—dead!—then Sorrow is no more:
Now let the Lightning flash, the Thunder roar!

LG.HEAD: AIR.
LG.L: Back to your Source weak, foolish, Tears,
Away, fond Love, and Woman's Fears;
The Dove shall soar with Eagle's Wing,
And fly to Heav'n, and Zoreb's Arms.

SP.STAGE: [Offers to stab herself; Moroc runs to prevent her, and in his Fright drops his Ebon Wand, which Kaliel takes up.

SP.SPEAKER: MOROC.
SP.L: Hold, desp'rate Fair— [Takes away the Dagger. No more will I employ
Love's softer Arts, but seize, and force my Joy. [Takes hold of her.

SP.SPEAKER: ZAIDA.
SP.L: Help, heav'nly Pow'rs!

SP.SPEAKER: MOROC.
SP.L: What Pow'r can Moroc fear?

SP.SPEAKER: KALIEL.
SP.L: The Pow'r of Virtue—which I now revere!
With thy own Arms thy guilty Reign I end,
No longer Moroc's Slave, but Zaida's Friend.
Thus do I blast thee—As the Thunder's Stroke
Blasts the proud Cedar—All thy Charms are broke.

DIV2.STAGE: [Kaliel strikes Moroc with the Wand, and he sinks.

DIV2.HEAD: SCENE IV.

SP.SPEAKER: ZAIDA.
SP.L: How shall I thank the Guardian of my Fame?[kneels to Kaliel.

SP.SPEAKER: KALIEL.
SP.L: Rise, Zaida!—Peace!—more thanks shall Kaliel claim.
Behold thy Zoreb dead to mortal View,
The Spells dissolv'd, shall wake to Life, and you.

LG.HEAD: RECIT. Accomp.
LG.L: This magic Wand, in Moroc's Hand
In Kaliel's Hand this magic Wand

DIV2.STAGE: [While the Symphony is playing, Zoreb rises gradually from the Tomb.

LG.HEAD: AIR.
LG.L: " What Angel's Voice, what sweet enchanting Breath
" Calls hapless Zoreb from the Bed of Death?
" But now I wake to Day,
" Too weak my Power's to bear this Flood of Light,
" For all Elyzium opens to my Sight."[looks rapturously on Zaida.

SP.SPEAKER: ZAIDA.
SP.L: O Zoreb!—O my Lord!—My bosom Guest!
Transport is mute! My Eyes must speak the rest.

SP.SPEAKER: ZOREB.
SP.L: And do I wake to Bliss, as well as Life!
'Tis more than Bliss!—'tis Zaida—'tis my Wife.

SP.SPEAKER: KALIEL.
SP.L: In Fate's mysterious Web this Knot was wove:
Thus Heaven rewards your Constancy and Love. [joins their Hands.

SP.SPEAKER: ZOREB, ZAIDA.
SP.L: No Power could divide us, no Terror dismay,
No Treasures could bribe us, no Falshood betray:
No Demons could tempt us, no Pleasure could move,
No Magic could bind us, but the Magic of Love.

SP.SPEAKER: ZOREB.
SP.L: The Spell round my Heart was the Image of You;
Then how could I fail to be constant and true?

SP.SPEAKER: ZAIDA.
SP.L: The Spell round my Heart was the Image of You;
Then how could I fail to be constant and true?

LG.HEAD: RECIT.
LG.L: Hover round and guard this Pair:
Love and Virtue triumph here. [Waves his Wand.

LG.HEAD: AIR.
LG.L: Ye Shepherds who pipe on the Plain;
Leave your Lambs and your Sheep,
Each Fiend of the Bosom destroy:

LG.HEAD: CHORUS.
LG.L: No longer united, no longer oppress:
For ever united, for ever shall bless.
